meanings.definition: A chemical compound used as an acid-base indicator.
meanings.sent1: In the science lab, we added phenolphthalein to see if the solution was acidic or basic.
meanings.sent2: The teacher explained that phenolphthalein changes color depending on the acidity of the solution.
meanings.sent3: During the experiment, the phenolphthalein blushed pink when it met the base.
meanings.sent4: The phenolphthalein was like a chameleon, transforming from colorless to pink in an instant.
meanings.sent5: The students were amazed by how phenolphthalein revealed the nature of the solution.

meanings.definition: A colorless crystalline solid that turns pink in basic solutions.
meanings.sent1: The phenolphthalein powder remained colorless until it encountered a base.
meanings.sent2: When mixed with a base, the phenolphthalein solution instantly turned pink.
meanings.sent3: The phenolphthalein blushed pink as if it had a secret crush on the base.
meanings.sent4: Her cheeks turned as pink as phenolphthalein when she realized her mistake.
meanings.sent5: The color change of phenolphthalein was as dramatic as a magic trick.
